qas.question: To what entity was all the power of the East India Company transferred?
How did Britain govern the vast area of India?
Over what did Britain have direct control?
What kind of influence did the British Crown have over the rest of India that was not under Company rule?
How many princely states were there in India in 1947?

context: In the aftermath, all power was transferred from the East India Company to the <a0_0>British Crown<a0_0/>, which began to administer most of India as a number of <a1_0>provinces<a1_0/>. The Crown controlled the <a2_0>Company's lands<a2_0/> directly and had considerable <a3_0>indirect influence<a3_0/> over the rest of India, which consisted of the Princely states ruled by local royal families. There were officially <a4_0>565<a4_0/> princely states in 1947, but only 21 had actual state governments, and only three were large (Mysore, Hyderabad and Kashmir). They were absorbed into the independent nation in 1947–48.
